creditline: Gift of Gerald Ray Nelson and Joanne Hogan Nelson
description: tailor with black hair, wearing square glasses perched low on his nose and a cap with a very large black pompon, seated cross-legged on a mushroom, threading a needle; scissors stuck into mushroom at man's PL side; frog, LRC; dragonfly, URC; spider webs between to bare trees at top
markings: ULC, impressed in card: [(...)ATHMORE / TRADE (thistle) MARK / DRAWING BOARD]
provenance: The artist; his stepdaughter, Joanie Nelson, Vancouver, WA
title: Untitled [tailor seated on a mushroom]
